name: Turkey
description: Turkey, officially the Republic of Turkey, is a transcontinental country spanning both Europe and Asia.  It boasts a rich and complex history, having been the heart of numerous empires and civilizations, including the Roman, Byzantine, and Ottoman Empires.  The country’s diverse geography ranges from the rugged Anatolian plateau to the Mediterranean coastline, offering a stunning array of landscapes, from snow-capped mountains to sun-drenched beaches.  Turkey is a crossroads of cultures, blending European and Asian influences in its cuisine, architecture, and traditions.

quickFacts.label: Population
quickFacts.description: Turkey has a large and growing population, making it one of the most populous countries in Europe.
quickFacts.detail: The majority of the population resides in the western and central regions of the country.

quickFacts.label: Area
quickFacts.description: Turkey's vast territory encompasses diverse landscapes and climates.
quickFacts.detail: It's the world's 55th largest country by land area.

quickFacts.label: Capital
quickFacts.description: Ankara serves as the political and administrative center of Turkey.
quickFacts.detail: It's a modern city with significant historical sites.

quickFacts.label: Official Language
quickFacts.description: Turkish is the official language of Turkey and has a rich literary tradition.
quickFacts.detail: English and German are widely spoken in tourist areas.

quickFacts.label: Currency
quickFacts.description: The Turkish Lira is the official currency of Turkey.

quickFacts.label: GDP
quickFacts.description: Turkey has a significant and growing economy.
quickFacts.detail: It's a member of the G20 and the OECD.

climateData.title: Turkey's Diverse Climate
climateData.description: Turkey experiences a wide range of climates due to its geographical location. The Mediterranean coast enjoys hot, dry summers and mild, wet winters. The Black Sea region has a temperate climate with cooler summers and milder winters.  The Anatolian plateau experiences continental climates with hot summers and cold winters.  Snowfall is common in the eastern and northern regions, particularly in the mountains.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Summer (June - August)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Summer in Turkey is hot and sunny, especially along the Mediterranean coast. Temperatures can reach 35-40°C (95-104°F).

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Autumn (September - November)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Autumn brings pleasant temperatures and fewer crowds. The Mediterranean coast enjoys warm days and cool evenings.  The Black Sea region experiences mild weather.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Winter (December - February)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Winter in Turkey is cold, especially in the northern and eastern regions. Snowfall is common in the mountains. The Mediterranean coast has mild winters with occasional rain.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Spring (March - May)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Spring is a beautiful time to visit Turkey, with flowers blooming and temperatures rising. The Mediterranean coast enjoys warm, sunny days.

naturalWonders.name: Cappadocia
naturalWonders.description: Cappadocia is renowned for its unique geological formations – fairy chimneys – created by volcanic activity and erosion over millions of years.  It’s a UNESCO World Heritage site and a popular destination for hot air balloon rides.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The region is dotted with ancient cave dwellings, churches, and monasteries carved into the soft rock. The surreal landscape is a photographer's dream.
viewingTips: Book hot air balloon rides in advance

naturalWonders.name: Pamukkale
naturalWonders.description: Pamukkale, meaning 'Cotton Castle' in Turkish, is a stunning landscape of white travertine terraces formed by mineral-rich thermal waters. It’s another UNESCO World Heritage site.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The terraces are a result of calcium carbonate deposits flowing from hot springs.  The ruins of the ancient city of Hierapolis are located above the terraces.
viewingTips: Bring swimwear for a dip in the thermal pools
Wear comfortable shoes for walking on the terraces

naturalWonders.name: Mount Nemrut
naturalWonders.description: Mount Nemrut is a mountain in eastern Turkey, famous for its ancient monument – a massive stone altar topped with colossal statues of gods and kings. It’s a UNESCO World Heritage site.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The monument was built by King Antiochus I of Commagene in the 1st century BC. The statues depict various deities and the king himself, creating a powerful and awe-inspiring scene.
viewingTips: Arrive early to secure a good viewing spot
Dress warmly, as it can be cold at the summit

ecosystemData.title: Turkey's Diverse Ecosystems
ecosystemData.overview: Turkey’s diverse geography supports a wide range of ecosystems, from Mediterranean scrublands to alpine meadows and Black Sea wetlands.  Significant efforts are underway to protect these valuable habitats.

biodiversityCategories.name: Mediterranean Flora
biodiversityCategories.description: The Mediterranean region of Turkey is characterized by drought-resistant shrubs, herbs, and trees adapted to the hot, dry climate.

statistics.details: A significant number of endemic plant species
Turkey is one of the world's largest producers of olive oil

notableSpecies.name: Maquis Olive
notableSpecies.significance: A key component of the Mediterranean ecosystem

notableSpecies.name: Wild Lavender
notableSpecies.significance: Used in traditional medicine and perfumes

biodiversityCategories.name: Black Sea Wetlands
biodiversityCategories.description: The Black Sea wetlands are a vital habitat for migratory birds and a diverse range of aquatic species.

statistics.details: Important stopover point for migratory birds
Provides crucial flood control and water purification

notableSpecies.name: Black Swan
notableSpecies.significance: A resident of the Black Sea wetlands

activities.title: Outdoor Activities in Turkey
activities.description: Turkey offers a wide range of outdoor activities for all levels of experience, from hiking and trekking to water sports and cultural tours.

activities.name: Mount Olympus Trek
